run(junit.framework.TestResult).Description: Runs the test case and collects the results in TestResult.

tearDown().Description: Tears down the fixture, for example, close a network connection. This method is called after a test is executed.

TestCase(java.lang.String).Description: Constructs a test case with the given name.

runTest().Description: Override to run the test and assert its state.

countTestCases().Description: Counts the number of test cases executed by run(TestResult result).

Returns: a string representation of the object.
toString().Description: Returns a string representation of the test case

TestCase().Description: No-arg constructor to enable serialization. This method is not intended to be used by mere mortals without calling setName().

run().Description: A convenience method to run this test, collecting the results with a default TestResult object.

setName(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the name of a TestCase

setUp().Description: Sets up the fixture, for example, open a network connection. This method is called before a test is executed.

getName().Description: Gets the name of a TestCase

ClassDesc: A test case defines the fixture to run multiple tests. To define a test case @B_junit#framework#Assert#assertTrue_E@ with a boolean. @B_junit#framework#TestCase#runTest_E@. It dynamically finds and invokes a method. In this case the name of the test case has to correspond to the test method to be run. suite as the entry point to get a test to run or it will extract the suite automatically.
